comment.text: The food, the service, the atmosphere was amazing! We had a large group of 15 people and the service was as if we were a table of 2. Our servers were very tentative, always refilling our drinks and wine, and had great recommendations. The feedback from our group was the food and wine were so good. I highly recommend!

owner_replies.comment: Many thanks for this shout out! We appreciate your business. Please do visit us again!!

comment.text:
The staff from the hostess, waiter, food runner, and table assistant gentlemen were beyond amazing. 

My wife and I got gnocchi (omg!), lobster ravioli, bruschetta, and calamari... oh and the tiramisu!! 
 
Everything was so good, I forgot to take pictures. 

I can't wait to come back ! 

P.S Cole was amazing!!!

owner_replies.comment: What a wonderful review!! Thank you so much for writing. On behalf of Cole, it was our pleasure serving you. See you next time!!

comment.text: Came to Atlanta for a short stay and was looking for a good Italian restaurant. The reviews were really good and it was walking distance from my hotel. I decided to walk over and get some bites to go so I could relax with a nice meal after a long day. Walked in around 6:30 and asked if I could sit at the bar (only 1 person was sitting there) and place a to go order. Was told flat out no, they weren't doing takeout. What a disappointment! Not very hospitable. This is one place I will never be visiting on future trips to ATL. :(

owner_replies.comment: We appreciate the feedback. Unfortunately, we are unable to offer takeout orders at this time. Hopefully you will change your mind and give us another try.

comment.text: My only regret? Not coming here sooner. We live two blocks down and we had never been here. Our first time was during COVID unfortunately, but we felt very comfortable. All of their staff had masks and socially distanced tables. Lynae our waitress/bartender was very informative and attentive. Absolutely everything was delicious. We ordered a Caprese salad to start (didn't take a picture due to us devouring it immediately) and then the lobster ravioli and tortellini. The tiramisu was amazing.  The picture of it is half eaten and  it was so good we forgot to take a picture of it in the beginning.

owner_replies.comment: Beautiful pictures! Thank you very much for the terrific comments. It was our pleasure serving you. Please do come back soon!!

comment.text:
Wow! Where have I been to just be coming to this wonderful Italian restaurant? Called same day for a 9pm reservation on Mothers Day weekend. We arrived 30 minutes early and was able to sit quickly. 

Wine: Asked for recommendation from our server similar to a taste of sangria but not too sweet. He suggested the Lambrusco Ca De Medio which is awesome. 

I had the Caesar salad which is very good. I told the server that it would have been perfect if it had anchovies. I was already mid way into the salad and he said if I want it, they have some and brought a good bit of anchovies. Talk about excellent service. 

Entree: My husband and I both had the Tortelli de Mele (House Signature dish).  I didn't want to have the same dish but the server suggested that we get it because it is that good. He said entire tables order it. Wow! I'm glad I listened to him. It has great flavor of both savory and a tad of sweetness. The pasta is al dente and the extra meat outside is great. 

The Chef's special dessert for the today is the Bailey's cheesecake. It is fluffy and the crust is nice. I'm funny about desserts as my Mom is a pastry chef but this is pretty good. I would've wanted just a bit more Baileys flavor but it's still good. 

Definitely coming back again! I'm impressed

owner_replies.comment: What a terrific description of what we have to offer. Say no more!! Your comments are very much appreciated. It was our pleasure serving you, and we hope you have a wonderful Mother's Day.

comment.text:
So I heard midtown is a foodie part of the area in Atlanta and I had to try one restaurant while in town. Made a reservation on open table and took a taxi from my hotel. Between Uber and taxi, it was about $8 each way.

They have quite a nice wine list and plenty is available by the glass. Cozy inside, actually each tables were a tad too tight.

So many dishes looked so good but since it was my first time, I had to try their house signature dish, Tortelli di Mele, ravioli filled with Granny Smith Apple, sausage and parmigiano. First bite of this ravioli, it was a mix of slightly sweet and salty, perfect harmony of different taste. No wonder why it is their signature dish.

I saw several appetizers looked so good but I had to leave  enough room for desert... as I was reading their reviews online prior to my visit, I saw their tiramisu was very good. I love tiramisu, I even ate tiramisu every day for two weeks while in Europe one time... oh their tiramisu was very good, the whole thing quickly went somewhere within 20 seconds of being served in front of me.  I throughly enjoyed it and washed it off with a nice cup of macchiato espresso. 

Service was very good, knowledgeable about wine and the food, attentive and friendly. Definitely worth the taxi ride from downtown.

photos.caption: Tortelli di Mele, House signature dish

comment.text:
OMG my experience here - just amazing!
We went as a group of 4, they won't seat you unless you have your full party when you make a reservation, but it's worth the wait. 

The servers are phenomenal and the atmosphere is low lighting and fine dining with a more casual feel.

We ordered a couple of appetizers (the pear salad was amazing) and I ordered the mushroom ravioli (or maybe the vegetarian one, I forgot the name). My ravioli (and everyone else's food) was a melt in your month experience. One to be savored for sure!
The portions are not big, but filling.

We ordered a bottle of wine and used the yelp 25% off coupon which was awesome!

To end the night, we had sorbet inside of a lemon and tiramisu! I wish I had taken more photos but the lighting was low and I wanted to savor the experience.

Def will be coming here again!

owner_replies.comment: Excellent to hear from you. Your mouth-watering descriptions are spot on. Thank you for taking the time to write. See you again soon!!

comment.text:
All I have to say is the food was horrible. I rarely give bad reviews but I had to come on here to let everyone know since most of the reviews are by elite accounts which are probably fake reviews.

The restaurant has an amazing ambience and the waiters are very nice. However the food plate presentation were unappealing and lacked taste and flavor. I had the risotto with lobster and it was just awful. 

I also had the arugula salad. At first they forgot to put pine nuts on there so I had to ask for it. Then the arugula salad itself was so DRY! No sort of dressing, just straight out of the bag and dropped on the plate with goat cheese and cranberry.

I just think they need to work on their food presentation and better seasoning.

owner_replies.comment: We do thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback. We are disappointed to hear you did not enjoy your meal. Certainly we understand that our guests have different tastes and expectations, but please be assured that we do not provide, nor have we ever provided, fake reviews. Hopefully you will give us another chance so we can find something more to your liking. Thank you for your business.

comment.text:
Wow wow wow! My helpers are soooo right. What a fabulous meal I had while in town for 1 night. Quaint place, not too big with tables close together. Bar area was packed. Sat down promptly and my server was so great. I took his recommendation and ordered the green apple pesto ravioli I think that's what it was called or at least that's part of it and holy cow was it amazing. It was an explosion of goodness in your mouth. I would have never ever ordered that dish without his recommendation. 
I'm still loving that dish. I had the salad to start and it was good as well. 

One note- it's very dim and hard to see your menu at night, many guests were using their phone lights.

photos.caption: This dish is beyond words. Just get it. Green apple pesto ravioli. You will thank me later.

owner_replies.comment: First, thank you so much for your business and for taking the time to write. We are thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your meals. And thanks for the feedback about the lighting. We do try to maintain a certain ambience but will keep that in mind. See you next time!!

comment.text:
Used to love this place but wow did it go downhill. For a place with such a long history I would expect consistency and flavor. Let me tell you my experience which I really hope is not common. Two people ordered the same shrimp pasta dish. Both dishes get placed at the same time. One has 8 shrimp pieces and barely any sauce. The other has 2 shrimp pieces and the noodles swimming in pasta water. We ask the waiter to why the inconsistency? The answer was that the dish is made in a batch and the range of the shrimp is from 2 to 6 per dish. They took the dish back and threw on 2 additional shrimp rather than recreating the dish.
The answer and the way to fix the situation literally put us off our appetite. Overall the meal was bland, service was ok but I'm still waiting for the spoon I requested.

owner_replies.comment: Our apologies that you did not find your meals acceptable. We do take all the feedback seriously, so thank you for writing. Please visit us again so we can improve your experience.

comment.text:
I've been sleeping on this Italian restaurant for years!

Environment: It's very unassuming from the outside and the layout is somewhat cozy, but the decor is well-thought out. When you first enter you are greeted by the bar which is fairly small and then that runs into the main dining room.

Food/drink: For dinner we had the Tagliatelle Verdi Alla Bolognese, Chicken Parmesan with Tortellini, a bottle of red wine, and Tiramisu for dessert. Both pasta dishes were delicious and the pasta was perfectly al dente. The Tiramisu was light and moist...a great way to end dinner; and the service was pretty good as well. 

The only thing I would have preferred was if there was more space between the tables so that you are not so close to the adjacent diners. Other than that, I would certainly go back to this spot.

After reading so many great online reviews, my husband and I chose this restaurant when his cousin came to Atlanta.
I need to say that our server (I think her name is Kayla) was outstanding: caring, fun and always attentive!
But the food? Only meh....
The Bruschetta appetizer was just bland and not even toasted. Not appealing at all. 
The Calamari was cold and tasteless. Weird...
I was lucky with my dish, I ordered a potato gnocchi which was quite good.
But my husband thought his tagliatelle verdi all'a bolognese was just bad. Definitely not the "hardy Ragù" promised in the menu.
I would give it a second shot because the ambience is quite nice. But foodwise, I was not impressed.

owner_replies.comment: We thank you for the feedback. Please do try us again so we can find something more to your liking.

comment.text: Amazing! Great ambiance. Fresh and delicious. They will accommodate even your pickiest eater!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you so much for the shout out!!

comment.text:
Solid 4 stars. The wines are great and the restaurant itself is quaint. I went here with a large group for a conference. Everyone was pleased enough with the food. 
The calamari and fried ravioli were pretty good. The tomatoes with the calamari were spicy and delicious on bread. 
The salads were ok. 
They tell u straight away, they don't make the pasta there, but have it brought in daily fresh. It was fresh, and the sauces were pretty good. Overall decent experience.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for taking the time to write and provide this valuable feedback. Hope to see you again soon!!

comment.text: The vegetable linguini was so incredibly delicious that i completely forgot i was in a bad mood. Like dang.

owner_replies.comment: That's great to hear!

comment.text: My food was amazing! The ravioli melts in your mouth I believe my boyfriend got the veal ravioli which was also delicious. Make reservations ahead of time because it does fill up and parking is limited. We ended up just paying for parking. We had old manhattans at the bar which was also good. I paired my ravioli with a Pinot noir they had can't remember the name. I highly recommend we went for Valentine's Day! Great for date night

owner_replies.comment: Thank you so much for the wonderful comments!! Please note that we offer reduced parking rates at the nearby Moxy Midtown Hotel (just across the street at the corner of 13th and Peachtree Walk). If you bring us your parking ticket, we can can validate so you pay only $6 for up to 2 hours of parking (instead of the usual $16). See you again soon!!

comment.text: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Atlanta, GA. The service- the flavor- the wine selection are all superior. I recommend the apple sausage ravioli and the bruschetta. The tiramisu is also AMAZING. I would go out of my way just to take a bite of that!

owner_replies.comment: So wonderful to hear from you. Thanks so much for the terrific review!

comment.text:
First time and enjoyed the food and atmosphere. The prices are reasonable and everything is fresh. 

We started with appetizers, bruschetta, then moved to the main entree, a cheese tortellini with grilled chicken. I found it a little dry but delicious. It was my birthday dinner so they gave me a dessert, tiramisu. It wasn't the best I've ever had. Those two things brought it down a notch but I'd go back there again for more pasta.

I came here for a birthday dinner and even though our party was not there the whole time, they were very patient with us as I could understand that they wanted to flip tables so that they could maximize the amount of people there. We luckily had reservations and the last person in our party already knew what she wanted so that wasn't that big of a problem. 

Inside, it's pretty much feels like a living room. One big room along with a bar and tables. I ordered their Chicken Cannelloni. I thought they were pretty delicious. We also had their bruschetta and a caprese salad as appetizers. The experience overall was pretty great. One thing was if you go, they keep the place quite cool out in the dining room, so don't be surprised you getting cold if you sit under the vent.

There isn't any free parking for this place, park right across the street if you want or one in the back. You're still going to have to pay but it's better than getting a ticket.

Went with my Italian language group and Ben was our server. He also is fellow yelper so he was selective in his evaluation of what dishes to recommend. He knew exactly what I "needed" the Tortelli di Mele, which was delicious and a specialty of the house.  I traded taste with the guy next to me who ordered the mushroom raviolis , this was also amazing!  I will definitely go back!. Parking is across the street and convenient, but they only validate PART of the bill. I was there 2.5 hours and parking was $6.
Still will return even if I have to pay for parking- it is worth it!

owner_replies.comment: We appreciate your thoughtful review. So glad to hear that you enjoyed the food. Yes, parking in Midtown is a challenge, but we do offer discounted parking at the Moxy hotel (validated up to 2 hours for only $6, instead of the usual $16). Looking forward to seeing you again.

comment.text:
I found this gem on Yelp and it had good reviews, so I tried it out.  Glad I did.

Small quint restaurant with outdoor seating as well. Inside the tables are set close to each other. Service very friendly and almost to quick to go from one course to another.

Before I could finish my caprese salad which was fresh and very good, my entree showed up.  Better timing needed between courses.

I ordered the lobster Ravioli which was listed as a specialty.  The dish was very rich and tasty. The stuffing boardered on being too salty. Right on the edge. I'd order again after asking about salt level.

I rode an Uber to get there and back so can't offer advice on parking.

As others have pointed out, the portions could be a bit bigger or a couple of dollars cheaper

owner_replies.comment: We very much appreciate the review. All feedback is welcomed!! Glad you enjoyed your meal. And, by the way, we do have parking located at the nearby Moxy Atlanta Midtown Hotel (just a short walk from our door). Guests can park for only $6 for up to 2 hours. Just bring your ticket to the host/hostess for validation. See you again soon!!

comment.text:
The food is great, the ambiance is romantic, and the service is knowledgeable. 

Prosciutto wrapped asparagus (to be honest, it's been too long that I don't remember what I thought of it).

I tried their popular house item, tortelli di mele. The pasta was cooked just right with the perfect amount of chewiness.

Buckwheat pasta had a consistency that I don't particularly favor. I'm also not a fan of scallops. This was tender but still did not sway me.

Parking is difficult in Midtown. There are paid lots.

Nice little Italian spot in Midtown ATL. The Tagliatelle were really good. Although I felt there was something missing in the dish I couldn't quite pin point as I polished it off even though it was plenty, more than half way in. Nice Ambiance inside - has a NYC SOHO feel. Staff and service was good all around. Would come back to try other menu items. Yelp says I'm rolling now but I have nothing else to add! :)

owner_replies.comment: Many thanks for the thoughtful review. We love the feedback!! Please do visit us again and remember that we change our dinner specials twice a week, so there are many options for you to explore!!

comment.text:
I RARELY take to Yelp upon leaving an establishment, but yet here I am.

I am infatuated with Pulcinella, to be blunt.

The unassuming exterior sets you up for a truly mind blowing dinning experience inside.

Not only the food was outstanding, the service and attention was by far, the best restaurant experience I have had in quite some time.

I have been to a few Italian food places in the North End of Boston, Pulcinella can hang with the best of the best there without a doubt.

Thank you John for the top notch service

owner_replies.comment: Those are great pictures...and your descriptions are terrific. Many thanks for the review.

comment.text:
This was one of the best meals ever. The food and service was incredible, and the cozy ambiance is delightful- they're in a cute little house on the corner. Tana and our server (so sorry I forgot her name!) took such good care of our rather large group, delivering amazingly delicious dishes family style starting with a huge assortment of appetizers including crispy ravioli with sauce, calamari with a tasty tapenade-like sauce, tomato and mozzarella, prosciutto. and bruschetta (I'm not a fan of bruschetta but this had great flavor and just the perfect crispness to the toast- we all especially loved the goat cheese on top).

We had two raviolis, sausage and apple as well as lobster...they both came in light and flavorful cream sauces that did not weigh it down. Also had shrimp and pasta. My niece who is THE pickiest eater in the world tried and liked everything served...a minor miracle. 

Dessert was lemon and peach sorbets, served in a hollowed out lemon and peach. Delicious!!

photos.caption: Peach and lemon sorbets with brownie and creme brûlée

comment.text: Their food was alright. Def recommend to make reservation or plan to wait. Its a nice cute little place. We didnt knw abt parking so paid $20 at public parking, but later found out that the parking can be validated for $6.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for visiting us!  Reservations are always suggested and we can usually accommodate walk-in guests most days.  And yes, we do offer a $10 discount validation for the public parking garage shared by the Moxy Hotel on 13th Street and AC Hotel on 14th Street.

user.name: Angel A.
user.address: North Fort Lauderdale, Fort Lauderdale, FL

comment.text: I amazing spot! Can't really go wrong with the food there and it's just a small family owned restaurant. Super cute and affordable.

owner_replies.comment: Great photos! Thank you so much for writing. We appreciate your business!!

comment.text:
Excellent excellent excellent Italian food.  Did I mention there food was excellent!  I wish I lived near this place.  Unfortunately I live in Philadelphia and only stumbled upon this place during a work trip. 

It's a hidden neighborhood .  I actually walked right by it not even knowing it was a restaurant because it looks like a house (I believe it is a house that was rehabbed into a restaurant).  There's a nice homey feel on inside as well.  It feels like you visiting grandmas house for dinner. 

See detailed info on food on my pics...
Outstanding food.  Rivals the best Italian I've had in Atlanta.  Little small but adds to the ambiance.  We will definitely be back.  Awesome awesome awesome food!!!

owner_replies.comment: Yes! Yes!! Yes!!! Thank you so much for the shout out!!

comment.text:
I do love that this is walking distance for my bf and I. We came here for a date night, and it was an overall really great experience. There was a bit of a wait (about 30 minutes), so we went for a walk outside because the entrance area is wayyy too tight for more than any one party to stand around waiting for their table. Luckily, it wasn't terribly cold that night that we were able to wait outside. 

_ Gorgonzola Walnuts & Goat Cheese Truffles $10
This was pretty good and came with two pieces of crusty bread. I didn't know what to expect. Because of the word truffles, I expected the truffles of the mushroom variety, but in actuality, we got truffle shaped balls of goat cheese. Which was so creamy, and really delicious. A surprise for sure. 

_ Ravioli Di Funghi $17
I had a few options in mind, and the waiter steered me in the direction of the funghi ravioli. It was a solid choice. The mushrooms were sauteed beautifully and the ravioli was perfectly cooked. Lots of delicious flavor in one bite, absolutely. The spiralized zucchini was an... interesting addition. I thought it was unnecessary, to be completely honest. I'm not complaining because hey, more vegetables to eat, but it didn't particularly add anything special to the dish. The only real negative to this dish was that it had too much oil. It was pretty greasy. I know the mushrooms are tossed in olive oil, but it was too much. 

_ Cheese Tortellini with Grilled Chicken $19
My boyfriend got the cheese tortellini dish and while the flavor was spot on. Some of the pasta was slightly undercooked, a few seconds shy of al dente. 

Foodwise, I think they know their flavors and they do them well. I think there are a few things to work on for improvement, but overall, this is a solid restaurant for a date night in midtown. The waiter was incredibly friendly. Took really good care of us and made sure we were having a good time. 

* One negative, there was a small nail sticking upwards out of my chair seat poking my leg. The waiter was quick to change out the chair though as soon as I mentioned it.

owner_replies.comment: For you to take the time to write such a considered and thoughtful review is very much appreciated. There is no better way to get the word out about our restaurant. We love the feedback and will take it all to heart. Apologies for the chair issue; it has been noted and addressed. Please come back again.

comment.text:
Delicious from start to finish. This place has a great atmosphere with a friendly staff.  I had Caesar salad, tortelli de mele, and creme brûlée. There were six people
In our party and everyone got different things and it was all wonderful.

owner_replies.comment: Great pictures!! Thank you very much for the wonderful feedback. It was our pleasure serving you and your party.

comment.text:
TERRIBLE....Terrible...Terrible!!!
This place signifies BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!  They will take your reservation and tell you when you arrive that there is no place for you...lie about alternate solutions and rudely tell you to leave. 
We were a large group, made arrangements a month back and reconfirm a day ahead. We were told when we arrived that they had no place as  our patio spot was unavailable due to the rain, and the inside tables were given away for those patio customers that had arrived before us. Maybe a valid reason, but the way the front reception handled it was just absolutely ridiculous ... told us that she should never have taken our reservation... to walk across the street and wait at a bar where none existed ... told a friend if he was God to predict the weather....rudely telling us to get out of the way ... and told us to leave. Now wait a minute!!!!  This receptionist should be fired and the restaurant needs to review who they hire and how they treat their guest. Never again here!!!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We regret that we were unable to accommodate your party. Our space is limited, and we do our best to make arrangements during inclement weather. Please do try us again in the future so we can make things right.

comment.text:
family of 4 dines I. A Friday night 
We wanted to try something different than our favorite Storico fresco ( great but v noisy) or Soto Soto ( poor service and stagnant menu) so we tried pasta de Pulcinella. first of all great service and we loved our smiling waiter Benjamin. The trout was bland, the rapini buckwheat pasta needed some spices, the linguine with veggies was okay, and the eggplant ravioli was okay. Salsa were fine m. the Super Tuscan needed some breathing and the Manhattan was sooo strong
All in all, glad we tried it
Won't go back though

owner_replies.comment: We thank you for writing. All feedback is appreciated and taken seriously. We are glad to hear you enjoyed the service (Benjamin thanks you!), but sorry to hear the meals did not meet your expectations. If you do change your mind, we would welcome you back.

comment.text:
Romantic setting, authentic Italian, excellent!

Just inside of mid-town Atlanta, you'll find this quaint house that has been tastefully converted into a nicely decorated Italian restaurant.  

The food is the real deal!  I had the house special, which is simply amazing!   See pics!

The pasta was perfectly cooked and filling was to die for!  Rich and married with just the right red wine... my, my, my...   gotta try this place.  A real Atlanta secret foody spot.  Trust me.
Amazing! Eat Here!!! Tortelli De Mele was incredible. Tiramisu was delicious as well.

owner_replies.comment: That's great to hear. Thank you!!

comment.text: Pasta Da Pulcinella is my favorite Italian spot in Midtown Atlanta.  I've been coming here for 4+ years now, and have yet to be disappointed by the food or service.  The staff has always been friendly & attentive, and I've yet to have a dish that wasn't delectable.

owner_replies.comment: That is wonderful to hear, and thank you for the beautiful picture!!

comment.text: Excellent food and a nice, quaint environment in the middle of the city. Great quality of food and environment for the prices we paid. Thank you Joe and the whole staff for the experience!!

owner_replies.comment: On behalf of Joe and everyone, we thank you very much!

comment.text: Beautiful and quaint little restaurant! The ambiance was great and so was the service! I wasn't a fan of the dish I selected, however. I had the tortelli di mele and I was expecting a savory ravioli dish. What I got, instead, was a very sweet almost dessert-like dish. I'm not a fan of mixing sweet and savory. Never have been. I avoid monte cristos like the plague. So, had I known this ahead of time, I would have ordered something else. I look forward to trying a dish better suited to my tastes!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you so much for the thoughtful comments. Please do give us another try so we can find something more to your liking. Take care!

comment.text: Made reservations and was seated immediately. Parking was $8 (cash only). Small place, seating is close. Lobsters ravioli was delicious! Bread is served and you can drizzle it with the olive oil on the table. Not many choices for desert but you can't go wrong with the peach sorbetto....amazing!

owner_replies.comment: That you would take the time to write is much appreciated. Satisfied guests are our best ally, so thank you very much!

comment.text:
Robert J. I visited you today - food was subpar. Service is always exemplary - honestly soooooo very disappointed with my mushroom ravioli which came out gummy - calamari lacked flavor. All in all today was underwhelming - visiting this time - with expectations of high bar from first visit  - made my tummy cry  

I will try 1x time before relegating this dining spot to after thought vs a must visit

owner_replies.comment: Thank you so much for your business. On behalf of Benjamin, and the entire staff, it was our sincere pleasure to serve you. Hope to see you again soon.

comment.text: I had the pleasure of having dinner here and it was phenomenal. I am very picky when it comes to Italian, but this place was amazing, the food was fresh and the service was great! I had the house special for the night which was tagliatelle with a tomato basil sauce along with shrimp. The taste and different seasons were really great and for a seafood selection at an Italian restaurant, it gave me the best of both worlds! An added addition is that it is very walkable to other places if you want to hang out before or after dinner!

owner_replies.comment: This is why we love what we do so much. Thank you for taking the time to write and share your experience. It was our pleasure to serve you. Please visit again soon!

comment.text: First time at Pasta da Pulcinella tonight!! Food was amazing and the service was even better. Kayo was an amazing server and provided great recommendations for wine, pasta and dessert! Will be back here!

owner_replies.comment: Kayo thanks you, and so do we! It was our pleasure serving you. Yes, please do come back soon!

comment.text: What makes this place amazing is the chef and  staff Lenne gave us so.e of the best items and they were amazing! Kayo our waiter took great care of us. the suggestions were amazing thank you Lenne! Dessert was just the great end to a delicious dinner.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you so much for your comments! On behalf of Kayo and Linne, know that it was our pleasure to serve you.

comment.text: We were craving pasta and found this place. The pasta was bomb,  and tasted really fresh. There was like a 40 minute wait but we went when it was crowded so no biggie. Seriously the food was good, our waitress was really nice too. The place is small but they indoor and outdoor seating. We ordered drinks ...they were actually stronger than we expected lol. I would definitely go back.

owner_replies.comment: That is great to hear! Thank you for your business and sharing your experience. Hurry back, please!

comment.text:
So let me start by saying, the ambiance was great. Very good setting in the restaurant. A cute place. The service was amazing as well. No complaints in any of those departments. Social distancing was pretty good as well. 

Now the bad part. We had a party of 6. We all ordered something different. Every person in our party enjoys Italian food. However, not a single one of us enjoyed our meal. The prices were okay, on part with nicer restaurants with smaller portions. But the taste just was not there for any of the dishes unfortunately. It was such a nice setting that I was hoping this would not be the case. 

I had the calamari, Caesar salad, and Chicken Cannelloni. The calamari wasn't bad. However, it seemed the squid itself was actually over cooked, while the breading was undercooked. The Caesar salad was amazing though. The chicken cannelloni was not the best though. It did not have a ton of flavor. I probably would not be back.

owner_replies.comment: First, thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts. Feedback is important and we take it all very seriously. Second, we are disappointed to hear you did not enjoy your meals. Third, we do hope you will reconsider and give us another chance to find something more to your liking. Thanks again.

comment.text: Amazing!  If you want a more contemporary Italian pasta establishment this is your place to go. Most dishes are all under $20. It's a lot of pasta that's all homemade raviolis and Bolognese and lasagna from scratch. The inside dining atmosphere is Very cozy and comfortable. It's very much like an old House turned into a restaurant. I am definitely coming back to this place as often as I can while I am in Atlanta on work trips or vacations and trips. The staff is young and funky and fun and professional.

photos.caption: One of their most popular dishes spinach pasta Bolognese.

owner_replies.comment: Yes, yes and yes!! Thank you very much for the wonderful comments. It was our pleasure serving you and we hope for many return visits!

comment.text:
Pasta Da Pulcinella is one of my favorite Italian restaurants I have ever visited. I have been here twice so far and love that they have a menu of "classics" and a menu of rotation specials - so you know there will always be some of their great classics but you can try something new each time you visit if you want to. 

The service has been great here both times I've visited - very friendly, accommodating, and quick. Benjamin was our waiter this past time and he let us try two different wines before deciding and we appreciate it so much! 

The food is delicious and portions are just right. I love that the portions are not too huge here like they can be at other Italian restaurants. The first time I came, I got the chicken ravioli and it was DELICIOUS. This time, I got the special spinach gnocchi with chicken and it was also very very good. We also started with the bruschetta. I did like the bruschetta but it was very different from traditional brushchetta (eggplant based rather than tomato based). 

Tip: They let you change the sauce on most of their dishes, so do not let the sauce on a choice deter you from getting it, they let all three of us try different sauces on our dishes.

I recommend making reservations because they can get pretty crowded. If you are a party of two, I would say be prepared to sit in close quarters to the table next to you because they do jam a lot of tables inside the restaurant. 

For parking: there are a few parking lots across from the restaurant. Seems like the price of these depend on the mood of the attendant, but last time I went I paid $8. 

Overall, I love pasta da pulcinella and I will definitely be back.

This place is a gem in the heart of Midtown. It is authentic, so flavorful, and the service is phenomenal! Kayla was awesome and she had quite a bit of tables but treated us all equally. I'll be back tomorrow. :)

owner_replies.comment: We greatly appreciate your comments! Looking forward to seeing you again soon.

comment.text:
We chose Pasta Da Pulcinella as our anniversary date. We've been looking for some good Italian food and one of my co workers mentioned that she liked this place. Overall, we enjoyed our night and the food was delicious! We recommend making reservations. We arrived 15-20 minutes ahead of our time and had to wait until closer to our reservation time before they could seat us. A couple arrived behind us without a reservation and I'm not sure if they were able to accommodate. It was busy and packed. 

We ordered an appetizer, 2 entrees, and a dessert. We got the mezzanine ravioli as our appetizer which we thought was ok at first. Then it grew on me after I mixed the sauce a little bit more. The fried ravioli wasn't crispy like we thought it would be. It was more like a soft fry. The filling was delicious. I think maybe there was a bit too much basil for my taste. 

My husband ordered the Tortelli di Mele. He loved it. It was savory with a hint of sweetness. You get a taste of apple with the first bite and then the sausage flavor follows. I ordered the Pappardelle Pasta with sautéed Sea Scallops. It was equally tasty! The scallops were tender and the sauce was a light tomato cream sauce. We loved their pasta! 

For dessert we ordered the creme-brûlée. It was ok. Nothing to write home about.  

Pros:
- delicious pasta! 
- excellent service
- cute patio. We would have sat outside if it wasn't so muggy. It would be great during the fall and spring. 
- portions were just right. Not too much and not too little. I ended up packing 1/4 of my pasta to bring home. 
- Decent price for the amount of deliciousness in front of you


Cons:
- no free parking. We parked in the lot across from the restaurant. We paid 8$. 
- LOUD. It was very loud. We had a hard time hearing each other
- tight quarters. You're almost sitting at the next table. I think we had maybe 6 inches between the tables.

photos.caption: We ate half of the appetizer before taking a picture
Pappardelle Pasta with sautéed Sea Scallops

comment.text: Service was amazing! Visiting Atlanta for a friends wedding and discovered this place on open table. Food was served fast and was very satisfied.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you very much for your comments! We hope to see you again in the future.
